subject: p16751749
Impression: Two frontal views of the chest show greater opacification in the left lower lung which could represent new pneumonia, less likely asymmetric edema because edema has not worsened elsewhere. Focal areas of possible hemorrhage in the right suprahilar and left lateral suprahilar lungs are unchanged, as well as the likely hematoma along the track of the right pleural tube. Heart size normal. No detectable pneumothorax. Extensive subcutaneous emphysema unchanged. Tracheostomy tube in standard placement.
